main.name: Kevin Pruvost
main.description: Hello ! I'm a student in Computer Science passionate about Software Engineering, Computer Graphics and Low-Level Programming
main.bio:
I am a passionate and hardworking developer, with a team working spirit.
I developped an interest through my years of coding in Software Engineering, AI, Game Development, Low Level Programming and Computer Graphics. I'm focusing the rest of my studies on these subjects, and for that, I'm currently preparing myself for a year of studies abroad, in the Tsinghua University, where they teach all of these subjects. For my future career, my ultimate wish is to get a job in of these specialties, in a company with passionate people from every levels of experience, where everybody wants to share their knowledge and where team work is at its best, in terms of fun but also of efficiency.
main.contactmessage: Do not hesitate to contact me, via email or phone call, I'll answer with great pleasure.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.degree: Masters in IT (Expert en Technologies de l'Information)
education.description: Mathematics, Unix Systems, Shell, Multithreading, Functional Programming, AI, GUI, Dynamic Linking, Low-Level Programming, Computer Graphics (SFML, SDL, CSFML, OpenGL), Web & Mobile Development.

education.school:
Lycée Jacques-Marie Boutet de Monvel,
Lunéville · France
education.degree: High School Diploma in Sciences (Baccalauréat Scientifique)
education.description: Option : Computer & Digital Sciences (Informatique et Sciences du Numérique)

work.title: Internship - C# / Unity Developer
description: Development of mobile games for events organized by professional clients, like BIL (a luxembourgish bank).
Worked on Augmented Reality & Virtual Reality applications and games.
Worked on databases, web applications and on the development of a REST API in order to create an environment where our projects could interact with each other.

work.title: Internship - C++ Developer
description: Development of a project template builder GUI in C++, capable of building new projects a lot faster, adding other projects' code or submodules from Gitlab.
Development of a TV program module and a Translation module for a vocal assistant (AI) in C++.

skills.name: C++
skills.description: It's my absolute favorite language and also the one I'm the most experienced with. I enjoy coding in C++ because of how complex yet creative it can be. I feel like I can do anything with C++ and that's why I love it.

skills.name: Python
skills.description: It's my second preferred language, it could be seen as pretty contradictory considering that my favorite language is C++. But the large variety of syntaxic sugars it has makes it much funnier to code for me.

skills.name: C#
skills.description: C# is the second language I'm the most experienced with. I made a several number of projects in C# including 2 on my internships. I think it's a great and easy language to work with.

skills.name: JavaScript
skills.description: JS is my favorite web language. Mainly because of how easy it is to start with, but also beacause of how fast you can write code. I had the opportunity to work on the Front-End of some projects, including one during my internships.

skills.name: React JS
skills.description: My favorite JS front framework so far, I've worked with it on multiple projects including this portfolio, and I really enjoy its ease of use and its simplicity.

skills.name: Laravel
skills.description: I use Laravel, mainly to make the back-end part of my web projects. As the documentation, the templates and the overall code available is pretty clear and practical to use.

skills.name: Git
skills.description: I used Git for all of my projects, whether it was with companies, for personal projects or for school projects.

skills.name: Perforce
skills.description: I'm still a beginner with the Perforce tools. I'm trying it out with some of my personal projects. I found out that some big companies use it because of how powerful and practical Perforce tools can be.

projects.title: Google Hash Code 2021
projects.category: A world wide programming contest organized by Google. Our team's name is Euclid Engine. We managed to get in the Top 3.9% (360th) in the world, and we got the 24th place among the french contestants.
